entries.title: Eddie Jones: Ex-England boss appointed Australia head coach as Dave Rennie sacked
entries.description: Former England boss Eddie Jones has been appointed Australia head coach, replacing the sacked Dave Rennie.

entries.title: The art school reject who became one of the world's top glass artists
entries.description: Little did Alison Kinnaird know when she was rejected from art college it would be the best thing that ever happened to her.

entries.title: New plans to widen police powers for disruptive protests
entries.description: Officers would be able to shut down protests before they cause serious disruption, under new plans.

entries.title: Suspected jihadists abduct 50 women in northern Burkina Faso
entries.description: People in Arbinda say two groups of women were taken while out gathering food because of severe shortages.

entries.title: NFL play-offs: Buffalo Bills hold on to beat Miami Dolphins 34-31 in thriller
entries.description: The Buffalo Bills hold on for a thrilling 34-31 win over the Miami Dolphins to book their spot in week two of the NFL play-offs.

entries.title: Quadriplegic cerebral palsy: Mum sees son walk for first time
entries.description: Thanks to new machine bought by his school, Jacob has stood up and moved his legs for the first time.

entries.title: West Ham Women 0-1 Manchester City Women: Khadija Shaw winner helps visitors close gap
entries.description: Khadija Shaw scores the only goal as Manchester City move to within three points of the Champions League places with a win at West Ham.

entries.title: Ambulance strike cover insufficient, says health secretary
entries.description: Health Secretary Steve Barclay says voluntary arrangements could not ensure public's safety.

entries.title: DR Congo: Government blames rebels for church bombing which killed 10
entries.description: Officials say fighters affiliated to the Islamic State group carried out the attack which killed 10 people.

entries.title: Tottenham 0-2 Arsenal: Gunners fans dreaming of Premier League title after outstanding victory
entries.description: Arsenal's outstanding north London derby win over Tottenham leaves the Gunners in control of the Premier League title race.

entries.title: Fresh snow and ice warnings issued across UK
entries.description: Snow is expected across the country, with yellow weather warnings in place across all four nations.

entries.title: Tottenham 0-2 Arsenal: Aaron Ramsdale attacked by fan after north London derby
entries.description: Arsenal goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale is attacked by a supporter after the north London derby win against Tottenham.

entries.title: Uranium: Man arrested over find at Heathrow airport
entries.description: A man in his 60s is held on suspicion of terror offences over the December incident.

entries.title: Tottenham Hotspur 0 Arsenal 2: Hugo Lloris own goal and Martin Odegaard strike sends Gunners eight clear
entries.description: Arsenal extend their lead at the top of the Premier League to eight points with an outstanding performance and win in the north London derby at Tottenham.

entries.title: Racing hold off Harlequins fightback in Champions Cup thriller
entries.description: Nolann Le Garrec kicks a late penalty to earn Racing 92 a first win in this season's Heineken Champions Cup with a thrilling victory over Harlequins.

entries.title: Walker rescued after being swept over Moffat waterfall
entries.description: The man suffered multiple injuries following the incident at Grey Mare's Tail waterfall, near Moffat.

entries.title: Dramatic rescue from rubble of Dnipro building
entries.description: A woman is rescued from the debris of a building in Dnipro, a day after it was hit by a Russian missile strike.

entries.title: PC Nick Dumphreys: Faulty police car decision too late, widow says
entries.description: Kathryn Dumphreys says if cars with a known fault had been withdrawn, her husband would not have died.

entries.title: Rangers 2-1 Aberdeen: Kemar Roofe sends Ibrox side into final
entries.description: Kemar Roofe's first goal of the season sent Rangers into the Viaplay Cup final to face Celtic as Aberdeen were overcome in extra time.

entries.title: Nepal mourns victims of worst air disaster in decades
entries.description: At least 68 people died when a Yeti airlines flight crashed on its approach to the tourist town Pokhara.

entries.title: Hook landslip: London-Basingstoke rail passengers face major disruption
entries.description: The landslip in Hampshire has severely damaged the track between London Waterloo and Basingstoke.

entries.title: Boy thrown from Tate Modern platform making progress, family say
entries.description: A boy who was thrown from a viewing platform has made "considerable progress", his family say.

entries.title: Women's Super League: Title race blown wide open by Sam Kerr's late equaliser for Chelsea at Arsenal
entries.description: Another bumper crowd at Emirates Stadium is welcome for Arsenal, but conceding a late equaliser and dropping points to title rivals Chelsea is much less so.

entries.title: Man Utd 6-0 Liverpool: United up to second after comfortable victory
entries.description: Manchester United move up to second in the Women's Super League after storming past Liverpool

entries.title: Masters 2023: Judd Trump takes 5-3 lead over Mark Williams in final
entries.description: Judd Trump opens up a narrow 5-3 lead over Mark Williams in the opening session of Sunday's Masters final.

entries.title: Newcastle United v Fulham: Alexander Isak scores winner after Aleksandar Mitrovic penalty disallowed
entries.description: Alexander Isak scores an 89th-minute winner after Aleksandar Mitrovic's penalty for Fulham is disallowed as Newcastle return to third in the Premier League.

entries.title: Chelsea 1-0 Crystal Palace: Kai Havertz header earns important win for Blues
entries.description: A thumping header from Kai Havertz earns Chelsea a narrow victory over Crystal Palace to ease the pressure on manager Graham Potter.

entries.title: Mykhailo Mudryk: Chelsea sign Shakhtar Donetsk forward in £89m deal
entries.description: Chelsea complete the signing of Ukraine forward Mykhailo Mudryk from Shakhtar Donetsk on an eight-and-a-half-year deal.

entries.title: British woman dies in avalanche in French Alps
entries.description: The woman was hiking with two other people on Mont Blanc's Argentiere Glacier, say French police.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Chances of more survivors from Dnipro strike minimal - mayor
entries.description: More than 20 people died after an apartment block in the Ukrainian city was struck by a Russian missile.

entries.title: Starmer: '16 is too young to change legal gender'
entries.description: The UK Labour leader voices "concerns" about the Scottish government's reforms to the process.

entries.title: UK set for cold snap after weekend of floods
entries.description: A severe cold alert has been issued for England from Sunday evening.

entries.title: Dad donates kidney to stranger after daughter's transplant
entries.description: Arfon Jones says he fells like he gave someone "a nice Christmas present".

entries.title: Euston shooting: Car appeal after six injured at London church
entries.description: A seven-year-old girl suffered life-threatening injuries in the shooting and five others were hurt.

entries.title: Rotherham: Biker seriously injured at 100-vehicle car meet
entries.description: A man is held on suspicion of dangerous driving after a crash at what police believe was a "car meet".

entries.title: 'I'm ready to leave behind teenage phenomenon tag' - Gauff column
entries.description: In a new BBC Sport column, American teenager Coco Gauff discusses how she can fulfil her potential by winning a Grand Slam in 2023.

entries.title: Brexit: Can better UK-EU relations lead to NI Protocol deal?
entries.description: UK-EU relations appear to be improving but big gaps remain in the Northern Ireland Protocol row.

entries.title: Pokhara airport: Plane crashes in central Nepal - at least 16 dead
entries.description: The Yeti Airlines plane crashed on landing in Pokhara, a town popular with tourists.

entries.title: I saw life and death on my first day in the job
entries.description: A student paramedic attended a home birth and a death within the first 24 hours of his placement.

entries.title: California battles deadly storms with millions under flood watch
entries.description: At least 19 people have died and millions are at risk of flooding as storms drench California.

entries.title: How drones could be the future of Indian farming
entries.description: Companies in India are encouraging farmers to switch to drones - but is that working?

entries.title: NHS must reform or die, warns Sir Keir Starmer
entries.description: The Labour leader says the situation for patients is "dangerous" as he sets out reforms for the NHS.

entries.title: Mexico tightens ban on smoking in public places
entries.description: The step, approved in 2021, means the country now has one of the world's strictest anti-tobacco laws.

entries.title: Why Michigan is trying to shut down Canada's Enbridge Line 5 pipeline
entries.description: An ageing pipeline is at the centre of a heated debate about environmental and energy concerns.

entries.title: The Nigerian AI artist reimagining a stylish old age
entries.description: Malik Afegbua's images of elderly models have blown up on Instagram, but they are not what they seem.

entries.title: NFL play-offs: Brock Purdy leads San Francisco 49ers to wildcard win over Seattle Seahawks
entries.description: Brock Purdy continues his remarkable NFL start by leading the San Francisco 49ers to a 41-23 win in the opening game of this season's play-offs.

entries.title: Biodiversity: Fungi are 'underloved and understudied'
entries.description: One scientist on why we should all pay more attention to the hidden world beneath our feet.

entries.title: Tory think tank Bright Blue calls for ‘minimum income’
entries.description: Bright Blue says all households need a guaranteed level of income to meet the rising cost of living.

entries.title: CEO Secrets: boxing boss reveals his punishing routine
entries.description: Ben Amanna, founder and CEO of Boxraw, which sells kit and clothing for boxing, shares his business advice.

entries.title: The man who first discovered plastic in the ocean
entries.description: In 1971 Edward Carpenter discovered plastic floating about in the Atlantic Ocean.

entries.title: Cost of living: The father and son who write poetry for tough times
entries.description: Winston "Mayor" Lindsay and his son, Zayden, perform poetry about socio-economic issues.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Slash NHS bureaucracy' and 'girl, 7, shot'
entries.description: Sunday's newspapers include Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer's NHS plans and a girl, 7, shot in London.

entries.title: Jesus baptism site makeover aims to draw a million Christians in 2030
entries.description: As pilgrims mark Epiphany, Jordan plans an ambitious project to upgrade place of Jesus's baptism.

entries.title: VR headset prices high as Apple bides its time
entries.description: New devices from Meta and HTC cost more than £1,000, but all eyes are on rumoured Apple glasses.

entries.title: MOTD analysis: 'It's a shocking decision' - Micah Richards on Bruno Fernandes goal
entries.description: Match of the Day pundits Micah Richards and Ian Wright analyse Bruno Fernandes' controversial goal for Manchester United against Manchester City.
